p: In 2012, a novel Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus (MERS-CoV) emerged. By February 2019, a total of 2374 laboratory-confirmed human cases, including 823 associated deaths, were reported globally in 27 countries (case-fatality rate: 35.4%) [ 12]. The majority of these cases were reported from the Arabian Peninsula, specifically Saudi Arabia (cases = 1896; deaths = 732; case-fatality rate = 38.6%) [ 12].
